conversation.text:
Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Zoo" and "Looper". 

"Zoo" is a sci-fi film set in a dystopian future where humanity lives in zoos for entertainment. The story follows the life of zookeeper Joe who has been living in a zoo for 20 years. He becomes increasingly frustrated with his life and he decides to take matters into his own hands by staging an escape from the zoo.

On the other hand, "Looper" is a science fiction film directed by Rian Johnson and written by Johnson, Jesse Taylor, and Kelly Reichert. The film stars Joseph Gordon-Levitt as a hitman who works for a company called LEPER that specializes in killing targets who are not worth the time of LEPER's professional assassins.

The plot of "Looper" revolves around the life of hitman Joe who has been living in a factory for 20 years. He becomes increasingly frustrated with his life and he decides to take matters into his own hands by staging an escape from the factory.

However, this escape plan goes awry when Joe is accidentally sent back in time to his childhood. There he meets the young girl who will become his wife one day.

However, due to a series of unfortunate events, including the accidental death of Joe's future wife during a car accident, the timeline of Joe's life is completely scrambled up and there are no guarantees that Joe will be able in the future, if at all, to reverse or correct the timeline of his own life.
